content: this text is a legal summary of a divorce case between two parties referred to as nj and sj nj filed a lawsuit against sj to divide their joint assets including an apartment and a loan agreement nj requested exclusive ownership of the apartment and compensation from sj sj counterclaimed requesting ownership of the apartment or its sale and equal division of the proceeds the court partially satisfied both parties granting nj exclusive ownership of the apartment and ordering compensation to sj the court also ordered sj to pay a state fee and for the remaining costs of the proceedings to be shared by both parties both parties have the option to appeal the decision within 30 days the court made decisions based on the evidence presented and the best interests of the child involved the court also discussed the division of jointly owned real estate and the obligations under a loan agreement the court determined that the property should be solely owned by nj and awarded compensation to nj the court obliged sj to give consent for the change in ownership and division of jointly owned real estate there was also a dispute over a loan agreement with the court determining that the obligations should be borne by nj and sj should compensate nj there was a separate dispute over a sum of 93 euros which the court determined should be divided equally between the parties another dispute involved a sum of 265 euros which the court determined should be divided equally between the parties with an additional amount owed by the defendant to the claimant there were also compensation claims made by both parties which the court found to be largely unfounded the court ordered each party to bear their own legal aid costs and ordered the defendant to pay half of the state fee for the appeal procedure the remaining procedural costs would be divided between the parties
